@norwood @ijuma @hachikuji Blocker for 0.10.2 since @norwood noticed licensing of connect jars was incorrect. I replaced cases of `..` broadly despite only needing to fix it in a couple of places for the connect jars since the relative paths, especially in the `subprojects` section, are error prone.

It would be nice to make the build fail if a requested file is not found. If anyone knows the gradle magic to make it do that we could avoid issues like this in the future.

@hachikuji If you recall, in the [PR for KIP-88](https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2074) we refactored the code to expose and use explicit `Errors` objects rather than numeric error codes, and limited the use of `short` error codes to the API response only. This PR expands on that and generalizes this refactoring throughout the code. Benefits of this refactoring include:

- quoting yourself on that PR, this makes the compiler do more work for us

- the code becomes more readable with the use of specific types

- the code becomes more uniformed as `Errors` objects are used across the board (and not a mix of `Errors` objects and error codes) -- except for when passing them through the wire when they are converted to a numeric code.

I'd appreciate your feedback when you get a chance.

I can move it over to trunk, I forgot about the auto closing thing and followed my normal process of building patches against the oldest release I want them in.

I did verify that the connect jars now have the two files and others, like the clients jar, still have both. I did not do more extensive comparison to verify all the other contents remain the same.
